refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: implicitplot(fun, [x_range, [y_range]]) implicitplot(fun, x_range, y_range, [options]) implicitplot(f_eval, x_range, y_range, [options])

listitem.para: a string or a function of variables x and y. The function to plot.
a real matrix of size [length(x_range), length(y_range)]. The evaluation of the function to plot on all points in x_range and y_range.
a real vector. The x values over which the function is sampled.
a real vector. The y values over which the function is sampled.
a list of options. The plot optional parameters.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: implicitplot(fun, x_range, y_range) draws the implicit function defined by fun(x, y) = 0 by evaluating fun over x_range and y_range.
If x_range or y_range is omitted, the range chosen is 100 points taken in $[-1, 1]$.
The function fun may be defined as a compiled scilab function, an uncompiled function or a string. The function must take x and y as input parameters.
The options defined by the options parameter can be any options of the plot function.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: // Draw a circle of radius 1 implicitplot("x^2 + y^2 - 1")
